ECSchema.description: The classes and relationships required for the physical representation of a building structure. As opposed to the representation used for structural analysis which is idealized to facilitate calculations, the physical structure more closely maps to the real-world structure and its elements for the purposes of design, fabrication and erection.

ECEntityClass.description: DEPRECATED: DO NOT USE.

Deprecated.Description: PhysicalModel should be used in place of this class.

ECEntityClass.description: An interface that indicates that this element is a structural component of a generic material.
An interface that indicates that this element is a metal structural component
An interface that indicates that this Element is a concrete structural component
A physical type for a structural component.
A physical type for a solid structural component.
A physical type for a profiled component.
A physical type for a tapered profiled component.
A physical type for a plate component.
A physical type for a generic component.
An abstract entity from which all structural physical components and assemblies are derived.
A component is the smallest distinct structural entity. It can't be broken down further.
A single structural entity that is built from smaller parts known as components or other structural assemblies
A solid structural component.
A structural component that has complex geometry that can't be described parametrically like an extrusion or plate.
Sheet of metal typically steel that is more than approximately 1 cm. (1/4 inch.) thick

ECProperty.description: The planar polygon or shape defining the boundary for the plate.
The thickness of the plate component.
Describes how the plate boundary is located relative to the thickness of the plate component.

ECEntityClass.description: A common structural extrusion designated by a cross-section (profile) and an extrusion path or length e.g. a prismatic steel column

ECProperty.description: The curve or line along which the profile is extruded or swept.
The identifier of a predefined point in the section definition to designate the location of the profile that intersects the path curve.
A 2D translation to be combined with the cardinal point to locate the profiles intersection with the path curve in-between or offset from the predefined points.
A vector which orients the strong axis of a profile about the path of the profiled component
Designates that the profile used in this component is reflected from its default position.

ECEntityClass.description: A tapered structural member designated by a starting and ending cross-section (profile) and an extrusion path or length

A structural assembly that does not function as a member in the structure, however, must be accounted for. e.g. Loose clips which mush be shipped to the site by the fabricator are examples of structural accessories
A major identifiable StructuralElement of the load bearing structure.
An assembly of members or components that acts as member in a larger assembly.
A plate-like superstructure StructuralMember that is primarily horizontal, and that transmits to its support locations (usually walls and columns) the applied loads, primarily through bending.
A plate-like superstructure StructuralMember that is primarily vertical, and that transmits forces to its base, primarily through compression.
A slender superstructure StructuralMember that is primarily horizontal, and that transmits to its ends the applied loads, primarily through bending.
A slender superstructure StructuralMember that is primarily vertical, and that transmits to its base the forces, primarily through compression.
A slender superstructure StructuralMember that may have any orientation, and prevents racking behavior, primarily through axial forces.
A StructuralMember that forms part of the substructure that transfers the loads from the superstructure to the ground.
A linear FoundationMember that transfers the load from a linear superstructure element (usually a Wall) or a linear series of closely spaced superstructure elements on to the ground.
A FoundationMember that transfers the load from a small number of superstructure elements (often one) to the ground, spreading the load in two directions.
A FoundationMember that transfers the load from the superstructure to a or pile or group of piles.
A slender FoundationMember, substantially underground, intended to transmit forces into loadbearing strata below the surface of the ground.
